items.text: I deserve special treatment because of my unique talents.
items.rationale: A sense of entitlement and belief in one's uniqueness are core aspects of Narcissism.

items.text: I often fantasize about being admired and respected by others.
items.rationale: Fantasies of admiration and respect are indicative of Narcissistic traits.

items.text: People often tell me I have a strong presence.
items.rationale: A strong presence can be associated with the charisma often seen in Narcissistic individuals.

items.text: I am more capable than most people.
items.rationale: Believing oneself to be superior is a hallmark of Narcissism.

items.text: I enjoy being the center of attention.
items.rationale: Seeking attention is a common behavior in Narcissistic individuals.

items.text: I often take charge in group settings.
items.rationale: Taking charge can reflect the leadership and dominance associated with Narcissism.

items.text: I have a natural talent for influencing people.
items.rationale: Influencing others is a skill often linked to Narcissistic traits.

items.text: I am not afraid to assert my opinions.
items.rationale: Assertiveness is a characteristic often seen in Narcissistic individuals.

items.text: I believe I am destined for greatness.
items.rationale: A belief in one's destined greatness is a core feature of Narcissism.

items.text: I often feel that rules don't apply to me.
items.rationale: Feeling exempt from rules is indicative of the entitlement seen in Narcissism.

items.text: I am very good at making people like me.
items.rationale: Charm and likability are often associated with Narcissistic traits.

items.text: I often think about how to get ahead in life.
items.rationale: Ambition can be a trait of Narcissism, but it may also relate to general goal orientation.

items.text: I sometimes feel envious of others' success.
items.rationale: Envy can be a part of Narcissism, but it is not exclusive to it.

items.text: I am willing to manipulate others to get what I want.
items.rationale: Manipulation is a trait of both Narcissism and Machiavellianism.

items.text: I am skilled at getting others to do what I want.
items.rationale: Skill in manipulation is a core aspect of Machiavellianism.

items.text: I believe that the ends justify the means.
items.rationale: This belief is central to Machiavellian thinking.

items.text: I am often strategic in my interactions with others.
items.rationale: Strategic behavior is a key characteristic of Machiavellianism.

items.text: I prefer to keep my true intentions hidden.
items.rationale: Secrecy and deception are common in Machiavellianism.

items.text: I am good at reading people and using that to my advantage.
items.rationale: Understanding and exploiting others is a trait of Machiavellianism.

items.text: I often plan several steps ahead in social situations.
items.rationale: Planning and foresight in social contexts are indicative of Machiavellianism.

items.text: I am not easily swayed by emotional appeals.
items.rationale: A lack of emotional influence is typical of Machiavellianism.

items.text: I often use flattery to get what I want.
items.rationale: Using flattery as a tool is a Machiavellian tactic.

items.text: I am comfortable bending the rules to achieve my goals.
items.rationale: Rule-bending for personal gain is a Machiavellian trait.

items.text: I often think about how to outsmart others.
items.rationale: Outsmarting others is a common Machiavellian strategy.

items.text: I sometimes feel that people are too trusting.
items.rationale: This reflects a Machiavellian view of others, but could also relate to general skepticism.

items.text: I believe that most people are motivated by self-interest.
items.rationale: This belief aligns with Machiavellianism but can also be a general worldview.

items.text: I enjoy taking risks without considering the consequences.
items.rationale: Risk-taking can be associated with both Machiavellianism and Psychopathy.

items.text: I often act impulsively without thinking about the consequences.
items.rationale: Impulsivity is a key trait of Psychopathy.

items.text: I rarely feel guilty about my actions.
items.rationale: A lack of guilt is a defining characteristic of Psychopathy.

items.text: I am often bored and seek out excitement.
items.rationale: Thrill-seeking behavior is common in Psychopathy.

items.text: I have a hard time forming emotional connections with others.
items.rationale: Difficulty with emotional connections is typical of Psychopathy.

items.text: I am often aggressive when I don't get my way.
items.rationale: Aggression is a common trait in Psychopathy.

items.text: I enjoy seeing others in discomfort.
items.rationale: Deriving pleasure from others' discomfort is indicative of Psychopathy.

items.text: I am not easily moved by others' suffering.
items.rationale: A lack of empathy is a hallmark of Psychopathy.

items.text: I often lie to get what I want.
items.rationale: Deceptive behavior is common in Psychopathy.

items.text: I am known for being charming but insincere.
items.rationale: Superficial charm is a trait of Psychopathy.

items.text: I often act without considering the feelings of others.
items.rationale: A lack of consideration for others' feelings is typical of Psychopathy.

items.text: I am often described as cold or unemotional.
items.rationale: Being perceived as unemotional is a characteristic of Psychopathy.

items.text: I sometimes feel that I am above the law.
items.rationale: This reflects a disregard for rules, common in Psychopathy, but can also relate to Narcissism.

items.text: I often feel restless and need to keep moving.
items.rationale: Restlessness can be a sign of Psychopathy, but may also relate to general anxiety.

items.text: I am willing to exploit others if it benefits me.
items.rationale: Exploitation is a trait of both Psychopathy and Machiavellianism.
